result.execSummary:
The defendant Cecilia L Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Agent to request probation review hearing if warranted.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test. Maintain absolute sobriety, from illegal drugs.
No contact with victim, Demetria S., without approval of agent and consent of victim. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
Obtain GED/HSED. Obtain and maintain employment.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge, (DV surcharge does not apply) and supervision  fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
No firearms; weapons (during period of probation). 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cecilia L Kirk

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cecilia L Kirk in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler for attorney Russell J.A. Jones.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
 AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety, from illegal drugs.  
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Demetria S., 
   without approval of agent and consent of victim.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* 30 hours of community service during period of probation.
* No firearms; weapons (during period of probation).
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge, and supervision 
   fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- dv surcharge does not apply.  
** AGENT to REQUEST PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IF WARRANTED.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not provided by defense counsel).  mld

AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea  Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-3-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 8-11-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued until further orderof the Court.  mld

Defendant Cecilia L Kirk in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge to Disorderly Conduct, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."    This now makes this case a misdemeanor.  mld

Defendant Cecilia L Kirk in court with attorney Russell J Jones.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pretrial conference held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on August 11, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.

Defendant Cecilia L. Kirk in court with Attorney Russell J.A. Jones.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case 2014CF818 called simultaneously with co-defendant cases 2013CF5802 and 2014CF817.  Upon the motion of the State, the Court ordered the following cases CONSOLIDATED for the purposes of trial: 2013CF5802, 2014CF817 and 2014CF818.  Court would allow defense counsel to raise the issue of the consolidation of cases, if they can bring forth new evidence.  

The State will be providing all remaining discovery to defense counsel.  Case 2013CF5802 adjourned for Evidentiary Hearing / Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-30-2014 at 8:30 am.  The State will supboena their witnesses for the hearing on 5-30-2014, per ADA Heitman.  Cases 2014CF817 and 2014CF818 adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-30-2014 at 8:30 am.   All (3) three cases 2013CF5802, 2014CF817 and 2014CF818 adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-11-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Cecilia L Kirk in court with attorney Russell J.A. Jones.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee County DA Investigator Anna Linden.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery, offer letter and Discovery Demand turned over to defense by the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-22-2014 at 8:30 am., along with co-defendant cases; 2013CF5802 and 2014CF817 (Johnny Hunley).   mld

14RM012325  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
3/4/14 vf

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Demetria S. and Johnny H.

Defendant Cecilia L Kirk in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cecilia L Kirk in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04 due to assignment of co-defendant's case. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
